storyInfo: Hoederer and Ines encounter a familiar face from the Scar Market, Ul≈°ulah, now serving as commander of a Feranmut skeleton. The three old hands cannot reach an accord. Hoederer and Ines manage to escape after a bloody battle.

attributes.text: Bumping into an old friend isn't necessarily a good thing for a Sarkaz.
I may not be a Sarkaz, but I know to come prepared.
When you're a kid, you're naive and stupid. A little camaraderie is enough to get you handing over your heartfelt trust.
\nEven if the place where you built that camaraderie stinks as bad as Kazdel.

Eventually, at some point, you grow up. Maybe it's the first time you kill someone, maybe it's the first time you almost bleed out, or maybe it's the first time you crawled out from under a pile of corpses.

\nYou start learning how to live in the grown-up world. You can be ruthless, you use any means necessary, you can even throw your friends under the bus just to live on, and nobody will hold it against you.
And then, that contrived plot comes around, and you bump into an old friend.
\nHonestly, after all these years apart, even if you're old friends, do you really have that much to talk about?
It's just... when you were young and stupid, you handed over that trust, you built a 'friendship'.
But when you're at that age, you have the unique opportunity to talk about 'friendship' in Kazdel without being laughed at.

attributes.content: Ul≈°ulah, we're done unloading. They're counting everything in at the warehouse.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Same as before: steel, pure gold, Originium, stuff like that. There hasn't been a personnel transport in weeks. Sounds like most of the forces from the Royal Court in Kazdel are already here.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: That makes things easier on us. Back when the Royal Court guys were floating around, they'd come down here and complain to us, made all sorts of trouble.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Stop.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: That's enough for now.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Oh, sorry.
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Hey, uh, Commander, I've been posted to the waystation for six months now. According to the rotation schedule, it's about time for me to‚Äî
attributes.name: Tired Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: I haven't received any new orders for you.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: But... your performance speaks for itself. I could approve three days of leave for you.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Ohh‚ô™ Our Ul≈°ulah‚ô™
attributes.name: Cheering Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: But don't let it go to your head, make sure to stay grounded.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: All your life in Kazdel, you were a cobbler. Your greatest accomplishment is nailing soles together. What are you in the running for, unless you're prepared to blow yourself up?
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Ul≈°ulah‚ô™ You're no fun‚ô™
attributes.name: Cheering Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: Get outta here, kid.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.text: I watch Ul≈°ulah's profile, the corners of her mouth curling up.
\nThinking back... back to then.
\nShe carries herself the same way, at least.
The young Sarkaz cobbler approaches Hoederer and slyly hands him a flask.

attributes.content: (Whispering) Hey, brother, hold onto this for me. Ul≈°ulah can't go a day without the stuff.
attributes.name: Slyly Smiling Sarkaz Worker

attributes.content: (Whispering) You're really something, man, walking around with this piece at your side, and still‚Äî
attributes.name: Slyly Smiling Sarkaz Worker

attributes.text: *sigh*.

attributes.content: Watch your mouth, cobbler.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What's sweeter than honey‚ô™ What's toxic as nightshade‚ô™
attributes.name: Fleeing Sarkaz Worker

attributes.text: Looks like he hasn't even had his coming-of-age yet. Those years with Her Highness Theresa did a lot to see these kids grow up nice and sheltered.
\nAnd now, he's in a war out here by Londinium. Hah, brother and sister joined hands to create the worst joke in history.
If only it wasn't a joke.

attributes.content: If you open that notebook, I'm setting it on fire.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.text: Hoederer quietly tucks away his notebook.

attributes.content: You two haven't changed. That's nice.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: It's been years.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Since that operation.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Me, Hoederer and W... the old W, got ourselves into trouble, killed some people we shouldn't have killed.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's not just the Scar Market, showing your faces in Kazdel would be trouble for you.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: I see your names there a lot... on the bounty lists. You're famous.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: I've never been a cheap date.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Sure enough. Ines's investment paid off well.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: We were all so young.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Getting old now?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I'm a Sarkaz, you're a sheep. In theory, I'm gonna live longer than you, Ines.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: We're all Infected, so this isn't about racial lifespans.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Good point. I'll drink to you and wish myself good health.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: ‚Äî‚Äîahhh.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: I remember you used to say that if a Sarkaz wants to live long, she needs to keep a clear head, before somebody else trades it for coin.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Whoever wants it can take it. Victorian, Sarkaz, doesn't matter to me.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.text: She leans in close, sizing me up, then glances at Hoederer.

attributes.content: You've got wrinkles, Ines.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: I died three times and only got a few wrinkles to show for it. I should thank the myriad souls.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You don't thank them, you're a sheep.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: As for Hoederer, you're missing an eye.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Wanna see the socket? It's all thanks to the fine Caprinae woman right here.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Lose an eye, or lose your head. You had a choice.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I guess Ines broke her heart when she made the move.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: ...Drop it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We're old friends getting together again, can't we get back to a nice atmosphere of sentimental nostalgia?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Talk about days gone by, muse on the passage of time...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We could talk about how you became the youngest major in the Military Commission, the driver of this skeletal Feranmut, Commander Ul≈°ulah.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Yes... we should talk about that. Otherwise, we being who we are, we shouldn't be so warm and friendly.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah
Ul≈°ulah
attributes.content: And we could also talk about you, these two Sarkaz...

attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah
attributes.content: One Sarkaz traitor, and one sheep. Why are you popping up at a secret Military Commission site?
I know you were detained by General Manfred, Hoederer.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: And you and Ines, who disrupted our operations, together with an obnoxious little girl planting bombs all around, stole into my territory, in broad daylight.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: As an officer of the Military Commission, I can't very well let that go.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: It's two against one here, Ul≈°ulah.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Is it? Remind me, where are we again?
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.text: Huh, since when?
\nThe girl wasn't like this before.

attributes.content: You're welcome to try, Ines.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.text: She's wearing a smile, but she's dead serious.

attributes.content: The most important thing I've learned over the years is to be true to my decisions.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: And Theresis is your decision?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No, the Military Commission is.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: You decided to go with Babel‚ÄîOr what is it called now? Rhodes Island? And I decided to stand with the Commission.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: We decided our paths a long time ago.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Ul≈°ulah, we can still‚Äî
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: I know what you want, Hoederer, you haven't changed a bit.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: But we're not those kids who strutted around cheery for a whole day on the back of a single bounty anymore.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: We don't get to relax after our missions these days, no idle afternoons on the streets of Kazdel.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: We are Sarkaz... or at least we're citizens of Kazdel. It's our responsibility to make those streets and alleys a better place.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Kazdel is the main issue here, Ul≈°ulah!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Then you've gotta admit, the Military Commission is the best choice we've got! Even Her Highness Theresa wouldn't disagree!
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: It was the two royals who made Kazdel into a nomadic city, the both of them who made it possible for us to even talk about the future of the Sarkaz here!
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: It was the same two royals who promoted me, giving a poor girl from the slums a chance to stand in the sight of the Royal Court, among those pure and ancient bloodlines.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Once trapped by naivety and compromise, the Sarkaz lose our chance at a true homeland.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: There's no room for me to hesitate here.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: The Military Commission, it's... it's the foundation for Kazdel to become a nation.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Will there even be a Kazdel once this war is over?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: All I know is I'm no traitor.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.text: Sure, we were prepared to bump into this old friend from the beginning.
\nHoederer tacitly crosses from my side to confront this stupid girl, the Major of the Military Commission.

attributes.content: Ten minutes, that's my limit.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Get as much intel on that thing as you can.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: I bypass several Sarkaz blocking my way, shadows entwining their ankles.
\nI leap up, climbing the nerve clusters of this terrifying creature, the slippery feeling making me slightly sick.
Is this a Feranmut? I've never seen one before.
\nShow me the secrets hiding in your mind.
This isn't a good section to walk on.
\nMy luck has been pretty bad lately, always ending up in the body of some kind of monster. Last time it was the revenant, this time it's whatever this is.
\nUgh, I hope I don't have to jump off it this time.

attributes.content: These 'nails' piercing its spine must be some kind of witchcraft device.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Are those nerve clusters trembling? Does this thing still have a will of its own?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She's here!
attributes.name: Spine Guardian

attributes.text: Ugh, how are they so quick? They climb up the skeleton in hot pursuit.
\nThe sinews between the bones become something like a ladder for them, with the splinters of fallen bone serving as their weapons.

attributes.content: Hm, they know war. Ul≈°ulah's trained a real elite unit.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But they could stand to work in some variety.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: All they've got on me is numbers‚Äî
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.text: A foreboding instinct pops into my head and I instinctively dodge to the side.
\nA huge cluster of nerves comes crashing down, and the bone fragments I have been standing on shatter and crumble.

attributes.content: It's so hard on itself.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.text: Hmph, looks like every bone fragment, every bundle of sinew here could be a deadly weapon. That's a pain.
\nThe nerve cluster wraps around again. I sink my dagger into it so hard that it recoils violently, carrying me high into the air.
\nAlright, so it has the most basic of reflexes.
Good enough. There's a cabin up ahead.

attributes.content: Right there!
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.text: With all my might, I grab the dangling bundle of nerves and leap away.

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough* *cough*!
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Dust everywhere... from wind-weathered bone.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: This should be the center.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hm, no clear interface. Is it driven purely by witchcraft?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: A willing slave? Or a marionette controlled by strings?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hmmm...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You dodged my Arts, Ines. That should've gone right through your heart.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: You still haven't fixed that old habit of yours, your casting always deviates a little to the left.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Lucky I've been on the bad end of that enough times.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: You in a hurry? Did Hoederer make a fool out of you?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's fragile, isn't it? Not as honest as it seems.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You're welcome to guess.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: If we get the chance, I'd really like to hear about those three deaths you mentioned. Must be a thrilling story.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: You wanna try once?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No, I'd rather us live.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: If you can make it through the chaos and live on, that is.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.text: A tremendous force flips me over, the nerve bundle sweeps away, trying to tug me with it. The Feranmut is gradually swinging its body.
\nThey've built a lot of cabins here.
\nAnd the thing tends to drift in the space.
What if the Feranmut wanders when I'm not in one of the cabins?
\nI really don't want to find out.
\nI'm not Hoederer, I'm not into becoming history.
Shadows, like blades, sweep through the hall of bone.

attributes.content: Save what's left of your dignity, Ines, there's no point.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Your shadows can't protect you from the might of a Feranmut.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.text: Weathered bone dust takes flight again, filling my vision.

attributes.content: Thanks for the reminder.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hoederer‚Äî!
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.text: Oftentimes, even I have to admit that Hoederer makes a pretty good partner.
\nI'm actually glad we didn't betray each other. It's hard to find a Sarkaz like him.
\nThe past was tough, and the future's gonna be tough too.
The dim firelight rises with the dust, twisting.
\nHis figure emerges from the embers, sparks in the wind singe his cloak and my hair.
\nAnd sometimes... only sometimes... I'm willing to tolerate his obnoxious Arts.

attributes.content: We're well past the age when we can talk about friendship.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But I'd rather live in a future Kazdel that keeps the 'silly' naivety we always laughed at.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: The turbulence is intensifying.
\nI grab his hand.

attributes.content: Sigh...
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: I forgot to tell you, Hoederer. General Manfred gave me your book.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: It's pretty good, I have to admit.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: You gathered up the bits and pieces, arranging them in chronological order, thinking you found the thread.
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: But you've been running all this time. Do you plan to do this forever?
attributes.name: Ul≈°ulah

attributes.content: Drop it, Ul≈°ulah, time to say goodbye.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hoederer, you're jumping with me this time.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Don't get swept away by the turbulence of history. Never forget the present... the life that you're living.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You're the boss.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.text: Boiling shadows point the way for us, scorched dust carrying us along.
The illusions shift before our eyes.
\nWhen I'm falling fast enough, I suddenly realize that history really does look pretty fragile and hypocritical.
I see a vast, and familiar battlefield. One of the war zones from Kazdel, where the flames are still burning.

\nI recall the past. Hoederer always wanted to steer clear of the war that tore apart his people. I force myself to turn my head, while he's single-mindedly focused on finding a suitable landing zone.
Run away from the war? Heh.
We weren't at Babel when Her Highness came under attack. We could have left Kazdel straight away. Why did we go back for W?
\nWhy join Reunion? Why lay low in Londinium all this time?
\nWhat is Hoederer fighting for anyway?
What am I... fighting for?
We break through the earth, the illusions vanish, and we see what was always there.
\nHe grabs my arm, telling me to be ready.
\nArts envelop us and my vision clears. Shadows rise from the ground.
Maybe we stopped running a long time ago.
